title: Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB: When the tab character in the first line is replaced with spaces so that the two lines are indented the same visually, executing the ShiftLeft operation does not move the text as expected. It is not clear how this behavior is specified, but in the first scenario, it seems like the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character, effectively getting rid of the tab. In any case, if there is a stray space, it becomes confusing why the text won't shift.
EB: When the tab character in the first line is replaced with spaces so that the two lines are indented the same visually, executing the ShiftLeft operation should move the text. In the first scenario, the second line should be shifted left, and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character, effectively getting rid of the tab. Additionally, it should be clarified how the behavior is specified to avoid confusion.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that the two lines are indented the same visually.
2. Execute the ShiftLeft operation.
3. Observe the text movement and behavior.

Alternatively:
1. Perform the steps mentioned above.
2. Pay close attention to any stray spaces and check if they affect the text movement during the ShiftLeft operation.
